Project.Brief history of your project and organi:
The goal of Common Voice is to create a free and open voice dataset that anyone can use to build voice-enabled apps and tools.

Most voice data today is owned by big companies and mainly includes English and other popular languages. This means voice technology often doesn’t work well for people who speak other languages or come from different backgrounds.

Common Voice changes this by asking people around the world to donate their voices. The project focuses on including voices from different languages, accents, and communities—like women, people of color, disabled people, and LGBTQIA+ people.

The voice data is shared publicly so that anyone can use it to build better, fairer voice technology.
Project.Describe the data being stored onto File: Dataset includes: High-quality voice recordings in WAV format, corresponding text transcripts for each audio clip, multilingual support, covering over 100 languages and accents, validation labels, indicating whether other users confirmed the accuracy of the recording, gegment duration data.
Project.How do you plan to prepare the dataset: To store data, first import it to create a unique Content Identifier (CID). Next, I establish a storage deal and divide the data into segments, which are encoded and replicated for durability. These segments are then sealed into specific storage units called sectors. Storage providers perform tasks like pre-commitment, sealing, and final commitment to securely store the data. They periodically submit proofs to verify the data's integrity. To access the data, the CID is used to retrieve, decode, and deliver the original content.
Project.In which geographies do you plan on maki: North America, Asia other than Greater China, Greater China, Europe
Project.How will you be distributing your data t: HTTP or FTP server, Venus built-in data transfer, Lotus built-in data transfer, IPFS
